definition: to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

sentences.english: The girl, obviously smitten herself, is afraid the boy will see her looking at him.
sentences.chinese: 女孩，显然地已坠入情网，很怕男孩看到自己在看他。

sentences.english: A successful marriage requires falling in love many times, always with the same person. (Mignon McLaughlin)
sentences.chinese: 成功的婚姻总是多次坠入情网，但钟情于同一人。

sentences.english: Couples who had just fallen in love had significantly higher levels of nerve growth factor, or NGF.
sentences.chinese: 刚刚坠入情网的恋人明显有较高水平的神经生长因子。

sentences.english: When I fell in love, I realised for the first time that I was lovable.
sentences.chinese: 当我坠入情网时，我才第一次发现我是会被人爱上的。

sentences.english: What do you get when you fall in love?
sentences.chinese: 当你坠入情网的时候你得到了什么？

sentences.english: Women fall in love through their ear, and men through their eyes.
sentences.chinese: 情话会使女人坠入情网，男人则是因为眼中的美丽。

sentences.english: Sometimes people say they just fall in love too frequently.
sentences.chinese: 人们有时会说她们会轻易的坠入情网。

sentences.english: Gravitation cannot be held responsible for people falling in love.
sentences.chinese: 万有引力无法用来解释人们是如何坠入情网的。

sentences.english: Nobody is perfect until you fall in love with them.
sentences.chinese: 一开始没人是完美的，直到后来你与某人坠入情网。

definition: to fall head over heels in love/to be passionately in love
the river of love/a stumbling block on the path to enlightenment (Buddhism)
change of affection, shift of love (idiom); to change one's feelings to another love/to fall in love with sb else

pinyin: ai4 de5 si3 qu4 huo2 lai2

definition: to have an affinity with each other (idiom)/to find each other congenial
stuck together as by glue (of lovers)/joined at the hip
to get married soon after meeting
first awakening of love (usually of a girl) (idiom)
(of a couple) to be harmonious/to be each other's sunshine
